title: The WeWork IPO debacle shows what happens when tech geniuses go unchecked
text:
WeWork, whose colourful chief executive Adam Neumann resigned on Tuesday, is not really a tech company. It is in the business of leasing desks, not software, and it headquarters itself on the opposite coast from Apple, Facebook and Google’s California bases.

But the company has borrowed many of Silicon Valley’s less-appealing characteristics. It commanded an enormous valuation of up to $47bn (£38bn) despite never making a profit, burned through billions of dollars of cash that was made plentily available by investors including SoftBank’s mega tech fund, and clung to lofty “mission statements” (WeWork claimed it was in the business of “elevating the world’s consciousness”).

But perhaps the most...
description: WeWork, whose colourful chief executive Adam Neumann resigned on Tuesday, is not really a tech company.
